enWisdom: One who wages war against the truth is ruined

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ مَنْ لَا يَنْفَعُهُ [مَنْ يَنْفَعُهُ‏] الْحَقُّ يَصُرُّهُ [يَضُرُّهُ‏] الْبَاطِلُ وَمَنْ لَا يَسْتَقِيمُ بِهِ الْهُدَى يَجُرُّ بِهِ الضَّلَالُ إِلَى الرَّدَى
enWisdom: Indeed, one who is not benefitted by the truth is harmed by falsehood, and one who is not set straight by guidance is dragged down by misguidance

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَجِدُ حَلَاوَةَ الْإِيمَانِ مَنْ يُسْخِطُ الْحَقَّ
enWisdom: How can he who resents the truth taste the sweetness of faith?
One who fights against the truth is thrown down
One who tries to prevail against the truth is overpowered [by it]
One who battles against the truth is ruined
One who opposes the truth is killed by it
One who opposes the truth is thrown down by it
One who opposes the truth is seized by powerlessness

Wisdom: مَنْ عَانَدَ الْحَقَّ كَانَ اللَّهُ خَصْمَهُ
enWisdom: One who opposes the truth has taken Allah as his adversary
One who transgresses the truth, his path becomes narrowed
One who shows his face [in opposition] to the truth is destroyed
One who transgresses the truth, his path becomes narrowed

Wisdom: مَنْ نَكَبَ عَنِ الْحَقِّ ذَمَّ عَاقِبَتَهُ
enWisdom: One who deviates from the truth, his end is dispraised

Wisdom: مَنْ أَضْعَفَ الْحَقَّ وَخَذَلَهُ أَهْلَكَهُ الْبَاطِلُ وَقَتَلَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever weakens the truth and forsakes it is destroyed by falsehood and killed by it

Wisdom: مَنْ عَانَدَ الْحَقَّ قَتَلَهُ وَمَنْ تَعَزَّزَ عَلَيْهِ ذَلَّلَهُ [زاله‏]
enWisdom: Whoever opposes the truth, it kills him and whoever tries to overpower it, it humiliates him

Wisdom: مَا ذَا بَعْدَ الْحَقِّ إِلَّا الضَّلَالُ
enWisdom: What is there after truth except error?
One who contends with the truth is defeated

Wisdom: هَلَكَ مَنْ بَاعَ الْيَقِينَ بِالشَّكِّ وَالْحَقَّ بِالْبَاطِلِ وَالْآجِلَ بِالْعَاجِلِ
enWisdom: One who sells certitude for doubt, truth for falsehood, and the Hereafter for this world is destroyed

Wisdom: لَنْ تَعْرِفُوا الرُّشْدَ حَتَّى تَعْرِفُوا الَّذِي تَرَكَهُ
enWisdom: You will never know rectitude until you know the one who has abandoned it
